CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Adenovirus, type 4 and type 7, live, oral
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine is administered as 2 tablets.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a adenovirus vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.Notes: Pandemic Non-US Vaccine not Authorized by WHO - not counted toward immunity in US

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 COVID-19 Inactivated Virus Non-US Vaccine Product (CoronaVac, Sinovac)
CVXInfo.Notes: Pandemic Non-US Vaccine. Authorized by WHO - Counted toward immunity in US

CVXInfo.Notes: Pandemic Non-US Vaccine not Authorized by WHO - not counted toward immunity in US

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, bivalent, PF, 10 mcg/0.2 mL
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, bivalent, preservative free, 10 mcg/0.2 mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA updated 04/18/2023 Moderna bivalent dosing (original strain + omicron BA.4/BA.5). Ages 6 mo through 5 yrs.

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, bivalent, PF, 10 mcg/0.2 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, bivalent, preservative free, 10 mcg/0.2 mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA updated 4/18/2023 Pfizer bivalent dosing, original strain + omicron BA.4/BA.5. Ages 5 yrs through 11 yrs.

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, bivalent, PF, 3 mcg/0.2 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, bivalent, preservative free, 3 mcg/0.2 mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA updated 4/18/2023 Pfizer bivalent dosing, original + omicron BA.4/BA.5. Ages 6 mo through 4 yrs.

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, bivalent, PF, 30 mcg/0.3 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, bivalent, preservative free, 30 mcg/0.3 mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA updated 4/18/2023 Pfizer bivalent dosing, original strain + omicron BA.4/BA.5. Ages 12 yrs and older. Not Authorized by WHO. Non-US Tradename for same formulation (Comirnaty Bivalent) counted toward immunity in US

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, bivalent, PF, 50 mcg/0.5 mL or 25mcg/0.25 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, bivalent, preservative free, 50 mcg/0.5 mL or 25 mcg/0.25 mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA updated 04/18/2023 Moderna bivalent dosing (original strain + omicron BA.4/BA.5). Ages 6 mo and older- dose schedule and dose volume may vary by age and criteria. Non-US Tradename for same formulation (Spikevax Bivalent) - not authorized by WHO - is authorized by EU and counted toward US immunity

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 10 mcg/0.2 mL dose, tris-sucrose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 10 mcg/0.2mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA (5 yrs through 11 yrs), Pfizer tris-sucrose pediatric primary series, IC, and booster

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 100 mcg/0.5mL dose or 50 mcg/0.25mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 100 mcg/0.5mL dose or 50 mcg/0.25mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA and BLA (18+ yrs), Moderna adult primary series and IC dose. EUA 8/31/2022 rescinded monovalent booster dose. Used to record Moderna vaccines administered in the US and in non-US locations (includes tradename Spikevax)

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 3 mcg/0.2 mL dose, tris-sucrose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 3 mcg/0.2mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA (6 mo through 4 yrs), Pfizer tris-sucrose pediatric primary series

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 30 mcg/0.3 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 30 mcg/0.3mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA (12+ yrs) and BLA (16+ yrs), Pfizer adult primary series and IC dose original formulation. EUA 8/31/2022 rescinded monovalent booster dose. Used to record Pfizer vaccines administered in the US and in non-US locations (includes tradename Comirnaty)

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 30 mcg/0.3 mL dose, tris-sucrose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 30 mcg/0.3mL dose, tris-sucrose formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA (12+ yrs) and BLA (16+ yrs), Pfizer adult primary series and IC dose tris-sucrose formulation. EUA 8/31/2022 rescinded monovalent booster dose

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 50 mcg/0.5 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 50 mcg/0.5 mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA Moderna, EUA 8/31/2022 rescinded use of this product for adult monovalent booster dose. Vaccine now only authorized for 6 yrs through 11 primary series and IC doses

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, pediatric 25 mcg/0.25 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, pediatric 25 mcg/0.25 mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA EUA Authorized (6 mo through 5 yrs), Moderna pediatric primary series and IC dose

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, pediatric 50 mcg/0.5 mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, pediatric 50 mcg/0.5 mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: Temporarily inactivated - Use CVX code 221 for EUA Moderna Pediatric 6yr to<12 yr vaccine 2.5 mL vial, 50 mcg/0.5 mL dose

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: COVID-19, subunit, rS-nanoparticle+Matrix-M1 Adjuvant, PF, 0.5 mL
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, subunit, recombinant spike protein-nanoparticle+Matrix-M1 Adjuvant, preservative free, 0.5mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: EUA 07/13/2022, 2-dose vaccine. Used to record Novavax vaccines administered in the US and in non-US locations (includes tradenames NUVAXOVID, COVOVAX)
Applies to tetravalent product (e.g. DENGVAXIA)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria and tetanus toxoids, adsorbed for pediatric use

CVXInfo.Notes: This code should be used to document non-US vaccines for DT,IPV such as Revaxis

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, 5 pertussis antigens
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a DTaP vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Diphtheria and Tetanus Toxoids and Acellular Pertussis Adsorbed, Inactivated Poliovirus, Haemophilus b Conjugate (Meningococcal Protein Conjugate), and Hepatitis B (Recombinant) Vaccine.
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine is different from CVX 132. Code may be used to document non-US vaccines (e.g. Hexamin) of the same component formulation

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: DTaP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
Historical diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis, poliovirus, Haemophilus b conjugate and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine.
CVXInfo.Notes: This is not the same as CVX 146, Hexavalent vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: non-US diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX was split off from CVX 102, to correctly identify the contents of the vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
Diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, Haemophilus Influenza Type b, (Pentavalent)
CVXInfo.Notes: This represents the non-US pentavalent vaccine. Should be used for historic documentation in US

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: DTP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA Approved ERVEBO Vaccine.
This vaccine is not available in the US.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: Do NOT use this code. If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85. There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent (non-US)
CVXInfo.Notes: e.g. Twinrix Junior available in Canada

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). It requires Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for that vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

As of September 1999, a 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) was FDA approved for Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for the 2-dose. This code should be used for any use of standard adult formulation of hepatitis B vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, dialysis patient dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: NDCs that are used for both vaccine and dialysis (e.g. Engerix-B) are mapped to CVX 43 which is not specific to dialysis use
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
New Hep B vaccine 1/2022

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, HbOC conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-D conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-OMP conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-T conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, conjugate unspecified formulation
Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and Hepatitis B vaccine
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine may still be in use until the existing lots expire on 8/19/16.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HPV vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza A monovalent (H5N1), adjuvanted, National stockpile 2013
CVXInfo.Notes: Approved by FDA 2013, adjuvant is mixed at point of administration.
This CVX should only be used for historical records where the formulation of nasal flu vaccine is not known.

influenza virus vaccine, H5N1, A/Vietnam/1203/2004 (national stockpile)
influenza, high-dose seasonal, quadrivalent, 0.7mL dose, preservative free

Influenza, injectable, Madin Darby Canine Kidney, quadrivalent with preservative

CVXInfo.Notes: New in 2013. IIV4
New in 2012. IIV4

CVXInfo.Notes: No US product available since 2017/2018 flu season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza virus vaccine, live, attenuated, for intranasal use
CVXInfo.Notes: LAIV3
new in 2012. LAIV4

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Seasonal, trivalent, recombinant, injectable influenza vaccine, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: RIV

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Seasonal, quadrivalent, recombinant, injectable influenza vaccine, preservative free

CVXInfo.Notes: IIV3. This is one of two codes replacing CVX 15, which is being retired.
IIV3. No US product available since 2018/2019 flu season. This vaccine code is one of two which replace CVX 15, influenza, split virus.
IIV3. No US product available since 2014/2015 flu season
This CVX code should be used to record administration of Southern Hemisphere influenza vaccine where formulation is unknown

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, high-dose, quadrivalent, 0.7mL dose, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Target population 65 and older, starting Southern Hemisphere season 2023

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: influenza, Southern Hemisphere, pediatric, preservative free

CVXInfo.Notes: Pediatric dose for ages 6-35 months

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, 0.5mL dose, no preservative
CVXInfo.Notes: Represents single dose vial

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: influenza, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, with preservative
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, 0.5mL dose, with preservative
CVXInfo.Notes: Represents multi-dose vial

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza virus vaccine, split virus (incl. purified surface antigen)-retired CODE
CVXInfo.Notes: This code is being retired. It will still be found in older immunization records. It included both preservative free and non-preservative free.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Seasonal trivalent influenza vaccine, adjuvanted, preservative free

CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Influenza vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Japanese Encephalitis vaccine for intramuscular administration

CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a JE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: meningococcal B vaccine, recombinant, OMV, adjuvanted
Meningococcal Groups C and Y and Haemophilus b Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y, W-135) tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine 0.5mL dose, preservative free
Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: meningococcal oligosaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4O)
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4P)
meningococcal vaccine of unknown formulation and unknown serogroups
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX is intended for use when any one of the meningococcal vaccines is recorded and there is no information about which serogroups are protected against. This code should not be used when a newly administered immunization is recorded.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine

CVXInfo.Notes: This code is used whenever the actual formulation is not determined or when aggregating all Novel H1N1 Influenza-09 immunizations for reporting to CRA. It should not be used for seasonal influenza vaccine that is not otherwise specified. (NOS)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Novel Influenza-H1N1-09, live virus for nasal administration

CVXInfo.Notes: This is the OPV that was used in the US

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Non-US monovalent oral polio vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories. It is composed of either Type 1, Type 2 or Type 3 oral polio vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Non-US bivalent oral polio vaccine (types 1 and 3)
CVXInfo.Notes: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories.
This code represents an oral polio vaccine where the specific formulation is unknown.
This is a foreign vaccine

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Pneumococcal conjugate PCV15, polysaccharide CRM197 conjugate, adjuvant, PF
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine 15-valent (PCV15), polysaccharide CRM197 conjugate, adjuvant, preservative free

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine 20-valent (PCV20), polysaccharide CRM197 conjugate, adjuvant, preservative free

This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a polio vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Human rabies vaccine from Chicken fibroblast culture
rabies vaccine, for intramuscular injection RETIRED CODE

This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a rabies vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

Unspecified code for COVID-19 not to be used to record patient US administration. May be used to record historic US administration if product not known. CVX code 500 should be used to record Non-US vaccine where product is not known.

CVXInfo.Notes: Pandemic Non-US Vaccine not Authorized by WHO - ACIP does recognize towards immunity in US

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, not adsorbed, for adult use
CVXInfo.Notes: Note that this Td is not adsorbed.

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Td (adult), 2 Lf tetanus toxoid, preservative free, adsorbed
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, adsorbed, preservative free, for adult use (2 Lf of tetanus toxoid and 2 Lf of diphtheria toxoid)

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Td (adult), 5 Lf tetanus toxoid, preservative free, adsorbed
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, adsorbed, preservative free, for adult use (5 Lf of tetanus toxoid and 2 Lf of diphtheria toxoid)

CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a historic vaccination when the formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Td vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Td, adsorbed, preservative free, adult use, Lf unspecified
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, adsorbed, preservative free, for adult use, Lf unspecified
CVXInfo.Notes: Used when Td Lf specification is unknown

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis vaccine, adsorbed

CVXInfo.Notes: Non-US vaccine

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Tick-borne encephalitis vaccine, inactivated, preservative free, 0.25mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: Pediatric dose vaccine

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Tick-borne encephalitis vaccine, inactivated, preservative free, 0.5mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: Adult dose vaccine
Unspecified Code - should only be used when specific vaccine administered is unknown

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: typhoid vaccine, parenteral, other than acetone-killed, dried
typhoid vaccine, parenteral, acetone-killed, dried (U.S. military)

CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a typhoid vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Historical record of a typhus vaccination

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Vaccinia, smallpox Mpox vaccine live, PF, SQ or ID injection
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Vaccinia, smallpox monkeypox vaccine, live attenuated, preservative free, subcutaneous or intradermal injection
CVXInfo.Notes: Associated to FDA US Licensed product JYNNEOS, non-US tradenames IMVANEX, IMVAMUNE. Review CDC & FDA guidance for updates regarding administration

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Venezuelan equine encephalitis vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a VEE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This is the YF vaccine that has been available in the US for years. It is stabilized with sorbitol and gelatin.
This vaccine is stabilized with sorbitol and lactose and has been used outside the US for some time. It will be made available in the US.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a zoster vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
This is the adjuvant that is packaged with H5N1 vaccine, adjuvanted
Do not use this code. This product may be used for Hep A and other viral infections. The correct vaccine / CVX is 86 (IG).

Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.
Code 99 will not be used in this table to avoid confusion with code 999.
This immune globulin may be administered IM only.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Rho(D) Immune globulin- IV or IM
CVXInfo.Notes: This immune globulin may be administered either IM or IV.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: respiratory syncytial virus immune globulin, intravenous
respiratory syncytial virus monoclonal antibody (palivizumab), intramuscular
respiratory syncytial virus monoclonal antibody (motavizumab), intramuscular

CVXInfo.Notes: This record duplicates CVX 13 (TIG). Do not use CVX 180.
TB Skin test is not vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tuberculin skin test; old tuberculin, multipuncture device
CVXInfo.Notes: TB Skin test is not vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tuberculin skin test; purified protein derivative solution, intradermal
CVXInfo.Notes: TB Skin test is not vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: tuberculin skin test; purified protein derivative, multipuncture device
CVXInfo.Notes: TB Skin test is not vaccine.
This CVX code has little utility and should rarely be used.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: varicella zoster immune globulin (Investigational New Drug)
